Hydras:
Hydras stood up slowly in a non treaten way, and camly walked a rou=
nd the Scene watching the battle when Tucson looked like more like Optimus =
and he said "Yesss, this will be like the old good times... tell me Scrappl=
ing, what's your relation with My old Pal, Optimus Prime?" said  hydras wit=
h a remarcable ironic mocking tone in the word pal 




From: Super Cyclonu=
s 
Sent: Friday, February 19, 2010 11:24 AM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Sub=
ject: Re: Recovering Rodimus/BlackFortress


  
The battle was not what it =
seemed . . . 
 
The punch Rodimus had thrown, the one that was so easily bl=
ocked by Tuscon, would have shocked Rodimus had it landed. He would have be=
en glad to be rid of this annoyance, yes, but it would have been somewhat d=
isappointing as well. 
 
So when Rodimus was spun around by Tuscon, the Aut=
obot may have missed the wicked smile on his face, When Tuscon tried to ram=
 Rodimus into a wall, he may not have noticed that the sound of crunching m=
etal was not Rodimus' but the reinrorced wall shearing and tearing under th=
e force of the assault. It was not the sound of Rodimkus' defeat that reson=
ated through the room, but it was something else!
 
Many of the same teache=
rs that had instructed Tuscon had trained a young Hot Rod as well -  Jazz, =
Prowl, Brawn, Kup, even Optimus himself! And while Rodimus no longer clearl=
y remembered all these ones and what they had meant to him, thier lessons w=
ere still ground into him, and his reflexes that had been honed over the ye=
ars of battle! 
 
Also, this was no young Hot Rod that stood there before t=
hem, but a figure shapped by the energy of the matrix into a character of l=
eadership, power and ability. He no longer had access to the knowledge and =
wisdom of the matrix, the energy having been stripped from him. But that po=
wer that had been imparted was still there, reconfigured by the power of th=
e predacon shell program! He was faster, stronger and far more durable then=
 Hot Rod ever was, he was DARK RODIMUS!
 
So when Rodimus hit the wall it w=
as not truely pain that he felt, but the elation that a true battle was in =
the making. He felt that charge that all warriors felt when they faced a fo=
e that had some metal! It was an eagerness twisted by Predacon programming =
into something dark and loathsome. 
 
So when he stood and turned around it=
 was not defeat in his stance but derision, "So you fancy yourself to be a =
Prime do you, scrappling?" Rodimus said his tone still mocking as he raised=
 his arm, smiling as his optics glowing with energy, "Well let's see what y=
ou got!" With a thought he fired a blast of plasma energy from his arm moun=
ted cannon at this new incarnation of Tuscon, who for the moment appeared t=
o be posturing for Hydras!
 
OOC: Remember, the matrix that is housed withi=
n Rodimus has no energy of its own, only the housing. It does not have the =
power to reach out and transform anyone, although I do have some ideas. I a=
m not sure if you want to redo your post, or let it go as it stands. 
 
Pre=
ston
(Cyclonus/Scourge/Dark rodimus)
